title: Bhopal gas tragedy: Toxic waste removed from Union carbide factory after 40 years - BBC.com
summary:
Bhopal gas tragedy: Toxic waste removed from Union carbide factory after 40 years

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: BBC News

Authorities in India have successfully removed hundreds of tonnes of toxic waste from the site of the 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy, where thousands died from a gas leak. The removal follows a court order aimed at addressing the long-standing environmental and health hazards posed by the waste.

  • 337 tonnes of toxic waste transported to an incinerator 230 km away.
  • The waste removal comes 40 years after the gas leak incident that killed thousands.
  • Activists express concern over the health risks of incinerating the waste at the new location.
  • Groundwater near the factory remains contaminated, affecting residential areas.
  • Previous attempts to dispose of the waste faced significant opposition and were abandoned.
  • The Bhopal gas tragedy is recognized as one of the largest industrial disasters globally.
“The 1.1 million tonnes of toxic soil and waste still continues to contaminate the groundwater of hundreds and thousands of people [in Bhopal],” said Rachna Dhingra from the International Campaign for Justice in Bhopal.

The recent waste removal is a critical step but highlights the ongoing challenges related to environmental justice and health for Bhopal’s residents.
newTitle: Bhopal Gas Tragedy: Toxic Waste Cleared After 40 Years

title: Nimisha Priya case in Yemen: ‘We will do whatever we can,’ says highly placed Iranian official - The Hindu
summary:
Iran to Assist in Case of Indian Nurse Sentenced to Death in Yemen

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Iranian government has pledged to assist in the case of Nimisha Priya, an Indian nurse sentenced to death in Yemen for manslaughter. The case highlights the complexities of international relations as India navigates support from Iran amidst multiple factions in Yemen.

  • Iran will advocate for Nimisha Priya, serving as a potential ally for India in the case.
  • The death sentence was confirmed by Yemen's President Rashad Al Alimi, with an execution expected within a month.
  • Priya was convicted of killing her business partner, with a history of alleged abuse in their partnership.
  • The Ministry of External Affairs is exploring options to resolve the case, including the possibility of blood money.
“We will do whatever we can,” said a senior Iranian official regarding assistance for Priya.

The international discourse surrounding this case may influence future diplomatic relations between the countries involved.
newTitle: Iran to Assist in Case of Indian Nurse Sentenced to Death in Yemen

summary:
'Kya bol rahe hain?': Bihar CM Nitish Kumar reacts to Lalu's INDIA bloc invite

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Bihar News

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has responded to Lalu Prasad Yadav's invitation for the INDIA bloc, expressing his thoughts on the alliance's prospects.

  • Nitish Kumar questions the intentions behind the INDIA bloc invite.
  • He emphasizes the necessity for unity and cooperation among opposition parties.
  • The Chief Minister urges for a collective strategy to challenge current political dynamics.
"We need to focus on working together for the greater good of the people." - Nitish Kumar

This statement comes as political tensions rise and opposition parties seek a unified front ahead of upcoming elections.

How many judges' children have been made seniors? Supreme Court slams lawyer for nepotism claim - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
How many judges' children have been made seniors? Supreme Court slams lawyer for nepotism claim

Publication Date: Thursday, Source: Bar and Bench

The Supreme Court addressed allegations made by a lawyer regarding nepotism in the designation of Senior Advocates. The court questioned the validity of claims against judges' relatives being appointed as Senior Advocates.

  • The Supreme Court criticized a lawyer insinuating nepotism among Senior Advocate designations.
  • Justice Gavai asked the lawyer how many judges' children had been made seniors.
  • The court warned the lawyer of potential consequences for failing to substantiate claims.
  • The designation of 70 lawyers by Delhi High Court has faced scrutiny and controversy.
  • One member of the Permanent Committee resigned over the alleged lack of consent in the final list preparation.
“This is a court of law and not azaad maidan of Bombay to make speeches. Make legal arguments and not for gallery.” - Justice BR Gavai

The Supreme Court provided time for the lawyer to reconsider the allegations made in the petition, highlighting the seriousness of the matter.
newTitle: Supreme Court Criticizes Lawyer Over Nepotism Claims in Senior Advocate Designation

Agra murders: Accused sedated 4 sisters, mother; used scarf, sharp object for crime - Hindustan Times
summary:
Agra murders: Accused sedated 4 sisters, mother; used scarf, sharp object for crime

Date: Jan 02, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The shocking incident in Agra saw a young man sedate his four sisters and mother before murdering them. This gruesome crime highlights deep family issues and alleged harassment from neighbors.

  • The murderer, Mohd Arshad, is 24 years old and allegedly confessed to the crime.
  • The victims include four sisters aged 9, 16, 18, and 19, and their mother.
  • The police suspect the victims were sedated as there were no signs of struggle.
  • Arshad claims he acted out of fear of harassment from neighbors.
  • The crime took place in a hotel room in Lucknow.
"He was afraid that if something happened to him, what would happen to his mother and sisters." - DCP Raveena Tyagi

This tragic event raises serious questions about family dynamics and community safety, emphasizing the need for support systems for vulnerable families.
newTitle: Agra Murders: Brother Sedates and Kills Four Sisters and Mother

title: Farmers' Protests | 'Why Can't Centre Make A Statement That Their Doors Are Open For Farmers?' Supreme... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Addresses Farmers' Protests and Government's Response

Date: January 2, 2024 | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court heard a petition regarding ongoing farmers' protests, questioning the Union Government's willingness to address farmer grievances, particularly the demand for a statutory guarantee of Minimum Support Price.

  • The petition was filed by Guninder Kaur Gill, addressing issues raised during the farmers' protests.
  • Solicitor General Tushar Mehta admitted to having 'no knowledge' about the petition.
  • Justice Bhuyan challenged the government to declare its openness to considering farmers' grievances.
  • Justice Kant suggested utilizing a High-Powered Committee to facilitate discussions between the government and farmers.
  • The Court instructed that a copy of the petition be provided to the Union counsel for instructions within 10 days.
“Why can’t the Central Government also make a statement that their doors are open for the farmers?” – Justice Bhuyan

In summary, the Court is pushing for transparency and communication from the government in dealing with pressing farmer issues.
newTitle: Supreme Court Addresses Farmers' Protests and Government's Response

title: Dallewal fast: SC blames Punjab officials, some farmer leaders for false impression on breaking fast - The Hindu
summary:
Supreme Court Criticizes Punjab Officials and Farmer Leaders Over Dallewal's Hunger Strike

Publication Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court has pointed out the misleading portrayals by Punjab officials and certain farmer leaders regarding the ongoing hunger strike of farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal. The court emphasized that the efforts to hospitalize Dallewal should not be seen as an attempt to end his protest.

  • Justice Surya Kant criticized both Punjab officials and farmers' leaders for creating a false narrative in the media.
  • Justice Ujjal Bhuyyan questioned the Centre's reluctance to address the grievances of the protesting farmers.
  • The health of Dallewal is increasingly precarious as he continues his fast, which has lasted over 35 days.
  • Justice Kant stated that hospitalizing Dallewal does not mean he must end his fast.
  • The farmers are advocating for a law that guarantees minimum pricing for their crops to protect their interests.
  • A court-appointed committee is set to meet with farmers virtually on January 3.
“This issue is becoming more and more sensitive, and time is passing,” Justice Kant observed.

Justice Kant described Dallewal as a “precious leader” dedicated to the farmers' cause and expressed concerns over the Punjab government’s lack of conciliatory measures.
newTitle: Supreme Court Criticizes Punjab Officials and Farmer Leaders Over Dallewal's Hunger Strike

title: On Adani power contract, Andhra CM Naidu now says: ‘Unless there is clear proof, we cannot take action’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Andhra CM Naidu Responds to Adani Power Contract Controversy

Publication Date: November 22, 2023
Source: Indian Express

Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu has stated that any action regarding the Solar Energy Corporation of India's agreement with the Adani Group will be based on clear evidence, emphasizing the importance of evidence before taking any steps against alleged bribery.

Naidu reassured that the government will carefully evaluate the situation and adhere to the law while addressing the allegations of favoritism in power supply agreements linked to the Adani Group.

  • Naidu reiterates that contracts cannot be canceled without solid proof.
  • The CM promises thorough examination before any action on bribery charges.
  • Recent US indictment of Gautam Adani involves alleged bribery of Indian officials.
  • Naidu calls out the previous YSR Congress Party administration for its governance faults.
  • He threatens consequences for those posting objectionable comments online.
“However big one may be, he or she is equal before the law.” – N Chandrababu Naidu

In conclusion, Naidu's comments suggest a cautious approach to the allegations, balancing legal requirements and political accountability amid rising scrutiny over the Adani Group's dealings.
newTitle: Andhra CM Naidu Responds to Adani Power Contract Controversy

title: Supreme Court to hear plea by Asaduddin Owaisi to implement Places of Worship Act - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court to Hear Plea by Asaduddin Owaisi to Implement Places of Worship Act

Published on: 02 Jan 2025, 8:14 am

The Supreme Court agreed to hear a plea by AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi regarding the implementation of the Places of Worship (Special Provisions) Act of 1991.

  • Owaisi's petition seeks the enforcement of the Act, which protects the religious character of places of worship as of August 15, 1947.
  • The plea has been tagged with another petition by Jamiat Ulema-e-Hind.
  • The matter is expected to be heard in February.
  • In December 2024, the Supreme Court ordered trial courts to avoid issuing orders or conducting surveys about existing religious structures in related cases.
“The Act explicitly prohibits the filing of such suits.”

This development emphasizes ongoing legal debates concerning the religious and historical status of places of worship in India, potentially affecting numerous cases across the nation.
newTitle: Supreme Court to Hear Owaisi's Plea on Places of Worship Act

title: Bangladesh court rejects bail plea of Chinmoy Krishna Das - The Hindu
summary:
Bangladesh Court Denies Bail to Chinmoy Krishna Das Amid Protests

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: The Daily Star

The court in Chattogram has refused to grant bail to Chinmoy Krishna Das, following a hearing with heightened security. This decision comes after significant protests and violence related to his case.

  • The bail request was denied by Judge Md. Saiful Islam after a 30-minute hearing.
  • Chinmoy Krishna Das is facing sedition charges for allegedly raising a saffron flag above the national flag.
  • The protests following his arrest led to violent clashes and the death of a lawyer.
“We will move for Chinmoy in the court for his bail.” – Apurba Kumar Bhattacharjee, lawyer

The ongoing unrest reflects deeper societal tensions and legal challenges within Bangladesh, highlighting the implications of the case on public order and legal proceedings.
newTitle: Bangladesh Court Denies Bail to Chinmoy Krishna Das Amid Protests

title: PM Modi's New Year gift to Delhi: Veer Savarkar College, WTC inauguration, flats to JJ cluster residents | Details - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Modi's New Year gift to Delhi: Veer Savarkar College, WTC inauguration, flats to JJ cluster residents

Date: January 2, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

On January 3, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the World Trade Centre in Nauroji Nagar and lay the foundation stone for Veer Savarkar College in Roshanpura. The WTC will provide approximately 34 lakh square feet of commercial space.

  • The World Trade Centre replaces over 600 outdated quarters with modern commercial towers.
  • It features advanced amenities and sustainable practices including a zero-discharge system, solar energy, and rainwater harvesting.
  • Modi will also visit Ashok Vihar to inspect newly built flats for residents of JJ clusters.
  • 1,675 flats will be handed over to eligible beneficiaries as part of the In-Situ Slum Rehabilitation Project.
  • The projects worth over ₹600 crore include academic blocks at Delhi University and Veer Savarkar College.
“For each flat constructed at a cost of ₹25 lakh, eligible beneficiaries contribute less than 7 percent of the total cost.”

This initiative aims to enhance living conditions of those in slum areas with modern facilities.
newTitle: PM Modi Inaugurates World Trade Centre and Other Projects in Delhi

title: Anand Teltumbde moves Bombay High Court for discharge from Bhima Koregaon case - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Anand Teltumbde Seeks Discharge in Bhima Koregaon Case from Bombay High Court

Published on: 02 Jan 2025, 7:30 am

Dalit rights activist Anand Teltumbde has approached the Bombay High Court seeking closure of the case against him for his alleged role in the Bhima Koregaon violence of 2018.

  • Teltumbde's plea follows a rejection by a special National Investigation Agency (NIA) court in May 2024.
  • The case against him alleges he was a convenor of the Elgar Parishad event that led to the riots.
  • Justice Sarang Kotwal recused himself from the hearing, citing past involvement in bail pleas.
  • Teltumbde is currently out on bail, with previous bail pleas being rejected due to alleged affiliations with a banned organization.
  • The Bombay High Court initially granted him bail in November 2022, which was upheld by the Supreme Court.

“Judicial propriety demands that it should be heard by a different bench,” Justice Kotwal stated regarding his recusal.

The ongoing case has significant implications for freedom of speech and dissent in India.
newTitle: Anand Teltumbde Seeks Discharge in Bhima Koregaon Case from Bombay High Court

title: Farmers Protest | 'Your Attitude Is There Should Be No Reconciliation' : Supreme Court Pulls Up Punjab Govt For Not Shifting Dallewal To Hospital - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Urges Punjab Government to Provide Medical Aid to Hunger Striking Farmer Leader

Publication Date: January 2, 2024 | Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court expressed dissatisfaction with the Punjab Government for not taking action to shift farmers' leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal to a hospital while he continues his hunger strike.

  • The Court clarified that shifting Dallewal does not mean he must stop his protest.
  • Justice Surya Kant stated that Dallewal's health must be prioritized while allowing his hunger strike to continue.
  • The Punjab Advocate General advised that Dallewal would accept medical help only if the Centre engages in talks.
  • The Court emphasized that irresponsible media portrayals misinterpret its intentions to compel Dallewal to end his fast.
  • The situation involves Dallewal's demands for a statutory guarantee for the Minimum Support Price for crops.
“Your attitude is that there should be no reconciliation. That is the whole problem.” - Justice Surya Kant

The Court has scheduled the next hearing for Monday, addressing Dallewal's broader issues related to farmers' protests.
newTitle: Supreme Court Urges Punjab Government to Provide Medical Aid to Hunger Striking Farmer Leader

title: Kashmir parts receive fresh snowfall; more expected from Jan 4-5: MeT - Greater Kashmir
Two WDs set to bring moderate to heavy snowfall in J&K from Jan 4-5: MeT - Greater Kashmir
summary:
Two WDs set to bring moderate to heavy snowfall in J&K from Jan 4-5: MeT

Date: January 2 | Source: Greater Kashmir

The Meteorological Centre Srinagar has forecasted intermittent light, moderate, and heavy snowfall in Jammu and Kashmir through January 6, with peak activity expected from January 4 night till January 6 morning.

  • Two western disturbances are expected to impact J&K from January 4 to 6.
  • Peak snowfall activity anticipated overnight from January 4 to January 6.
  • Moderate rain forecasted for the plains with snow in most areas.
  • Heavy snow possible at isolated higher reaches during January 4 night to January 5 late night.
  • Advisories recommended for tourists and travelers due to icy road conditions.

The weather is expected to improve from January 6 afternoon, with drier conditions forecasted from January 7 to 10.
newTitle: Moderate to Heavy Snowfall Expected in J&K from January 4-5

title: SC considers Owaisi's plea seeking to maintain 1991 places of worship law - The Times of India
summary:
SC considers Owaisi's plea seeking to maintain 1991 places of worship law

Date: Not specified
Source: Times of India

The Supreme Court is examining the plea put forth by Asaduddin Owaisi, which seeks to uphold the 1991 places of worship law that preserves the religious character of places of worship as they were on August 15, 1947.

  • The law aims to maintain the status quo of religious places in India.
  • Owaisi argues that the law is crucial for protecting communal harmony in the country.
  • There has been ongoing debate regarding the implications of this law on communal relations.
"Maintaining the status quo is necessary for peace and unity among different religious communities in India." - Asaduddin Owaisi

The outcome of this case could significantly impact India's approach to religious disputes and the management of places of worship.
newTitle: Supreme Court Reviews Owaisi's Appeal on 1991 Places of Worship Law

title: Anna University sexual assault case being politicised without genuine concern, says Madras HC Judge - The Hindu
summary:
Madras HC Judge Critiques Political Response to Anna University Sexual Assault Case

Publication Date: January 02, 2025 11:41 am IST

Source: The Hindu

Justice P. Velmurugan of the Madras High Court expressed deep concern over the politicization of the Anna University sexual assault case, highlighting societal indifference towards women's rights and criticizing the lack of genuine concerns from political parties.

  • The Judge emphasized that the incident should serve as a wake-up call to society.
  • Political protests were seen as attempts to gain media attention rather than authentic concern.
  • Justice Velmurugan criticized the media for conducting a 'media trial' rather than responsible reporting.
  • He condemned the mindset of viewing women as needing 'protection,' advocating for gender equality.
  • An all-woman IPS officers’ team has been formed to investigate the case.
“I’m ashamed to live in this era when discrimination based on gender, caste, and so on continues.” - Justice P. Velmurugan

In conclusion, the Judge called for collective shame in the face of ongoing gender discrimination and underscored the need for real change in societal attitudes towards women.
newTitle: Madras HC Judge Critiques Political Response to Anna University Sexual Assault Case

title: Setback for Hindu monk Chinmoy Krishna Das as Bangladesh court rejects bail plea - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bangladesh Court Denies Bail to Hindu Monk Chinmoy Krishna Das

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A Chattogram court in Bangladesh has denied bail to Chinmoy Krishna Das, a former ISKCON monk, during a tightly secured hearing.

  • The court hearing lasted about 30 minutes with arguments presented by both sides.
  • A team of 11 Supreme Court lawyers represented Chinmoy Krishna Das.
  • His bail plea was rejected by Metropolitan Sessions judge Md Saiful Islam.
  • Chinmoy faces sedition charges for allegedly raising a saffron flag above Bangladesh's national flag.
  • His arrest on November 25 led to protests and clashes resulting in a lawyer's death.
  • Additional arrests of fellow monks occurred amid the unrest.
  • The Indian government expressed concern over the situation in Bangladesh.
“We will move for Chinmoy in the court for his bail.” - Lawyer Apurba Kumar Bhattacharjee

The decision by the Chattogram court highlights ongoing tensions in Bangladesh regarding minority rights and protests against extremism.
newTitle: Bangladesh Court Denies Bail to Hindu Monk Chinmoy Krishna Das

title: One year enough for GoI: CM Omar Abdullah on restoration of Statehood to Jammu and Kashmir - Greater Kashmir
Uma Thomas accident: Footage showing Kerala MLA falling from stage exposes flagrant violation of safety norms - The Hindu
summary:
Uma Thomas accident: Footage showing Kerala MLA falling from stage exposes flagrant violation of safety norms

Published on: January 02, 2025 11:31 am IST

Source: The Hindu

A video has surfaced showing Kerala MLA Uma Thomas falling from a makeshift stage, highlighting serious safety violations. She is currently on ventilator support after the incident which occurred during a mass dance event at Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium.

  • Footage reveals a lack of adequate space and support on the stage.
  • Authorities have identified unsafe stage construction, including a notable tilt.
  • The police have registered a case against the event organizers for negligence.
  • The Kochi Corporation has suspended a health inspector for overlooking safety norms.
"The Kochi City police had already found flagrant violation of safety norms in the way the stage was set up."

This incident has raised questions about the safety measures at public events and has prompted calls for stricter regulations.
newTitle: MLA Uma Thomas Falls from Stage Due to Safety Violations, Sparks Outrage
